docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: A novel use of an old technique is forcing new attention on one of the most wrenching issues in medicine: the use of babies born without brains as organ donors.

headline.main: New Attention Focused On Infant Organ Donors

docs.snippet: LEAD: A novel use of an old technique is forcing new attention on one of the most wrenching issues in medicine: the use of babies born without brains as organ donors.

byline.original: By SANDRA BLAKESLEE, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: A physician confessed that at first he hated his colicky newborn daughter, whose ''continuous high-pitched shriek'' made him want to shake her until she stopped. ''God, I thought, how can such a small helpless infant, my own beloved flesh, evoke such nearly uncontrollable hostility in me, her daddy, a physician?
docs.snippet: LEAD: A physician confessed that at first he hated his colicky newborn daughter, whose ''continuous high-pitched shriek'' made him want to shake her until she stopped. ''God, I thought, how can such a small helpless infant, my own beloved flesh,...

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Environmental Protection Agency, in a new draft study with the potential for far-reaching policy implications, has sharply reduced its estimate of the cancer-causing potential of dioxin, a widespread chemical pollutant.

headline.main: Estimate of Risk Of Dioxin Is Cut In Cancer Study

docs.snippet: LEAD: The Environmental Protection Agency, in a new draft study with the potential for far-reaching policy implications, has sharply reduced its estimate of the cancer-causing potential of dioxin, a widespread chemical pollutant.

byline.original: By PHILIP SHABECOFF, Special to the New York Times
